metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6831 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A buffer overflow could occur when parsing and validating SCTP chunks inWebRTC. This could have led to memory corruption and a potentiallyexploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.8, Firefox <76, and Thunderbird < 68.8.0.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
